com.googlecode.aluminumproject.cli
Interface OptionEffect<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the option argument(s) (if any)
All Known Implementing Classes:
PropertyEffect
public interface OptionEffect<T>

The effect of an option on a command.

In general, option effects shouldn't take any immediate acion when they are applied; other options could have influence on the behaviour of the command. Therefore, option effects should rather change the command's state, so that the command can decide what to do with the given options when it is executed.

Method Summary
 void apply(OptionSet options, OptionSpec<T> option)
          Applies this option effect to the command that accepts the option.
 

Method Detail

Applies this option effect to the command that accepts the option.

Parameters:
options - the set of supplied options
option - the option that causes this effect
Throws:
CommandException - when this option effect can't be applied
